about.title: About Us
about.description:
“Little Great Minds” is a space where both children and parents come together to grow as a family. Our vision as an early childhood center is to make every day an opportunity for little ones to naturally discover the world around them through curiosity, movement, and play, while parents feel supported throughout the process.
Our main teaching foundation is the Creative Curriculum for Infants and Toddlers, which provides a research-based educational approach. This curriculum allows children to take the lead in their learning journey, offering a respectful and natural approach for our little ones.

infantCare.title: Creative Curriculum for Infants (0-1 years)
infantCare.description: Providing a loving and secure environment for your little ones.
infantCare.details: The Creative Curriculum for Infants focuses on building secure attachments through responsive caregiving, sensory exploration, and individualized routines. Babies learn best in a nurturing environment where caregivers support their natural curiosity, encourage early communication through songs and interactions, and provide opportunities for movement and discovery. By following each child's unique rhythms, the curriculum fosters a sense of security, promotes development, and lays the foundation for lifelong learning.
infantCare.keyFocus: Building trust, sensory stimulation, and early motor skills.

toddlerProgram.title: Creative Curriculum for Toddlers (1-2 years)
toddlerProgram.description: Encouraging exploration and developing essential motor skills.
toddlerProgram.details: The Creative Curriculum for Toddlers focuses on fostering independence, curiosity, and early social-emotional skills through play-based learning and exploration. At this stage, toddlers are eager to move, touch, and discover their surroundings, so the curriculum provides a safe and engaging environment where they can explore freely. Through responsive caregiving, simple routines, and meaningful interactions, toddlers develop language, problem-solving abilities, and confidence while learning to express their emotions and build relationships with others.
activities: Creative play with shapes and colors
toddlerProgram.keyFocus: Promoting curiosity, coordination, and social engagement.

preschool.title: Creative Curriculum for Twos (2-3 years)
preschool.description: Fostering a solid foundation for academic and social success.
preschool.details: The Creative Curriculum for Twos supports growing independence, language development, and early cognitive skills through hands-on, interactive experiences. Twos are naturally curious and thrive in an environment that encourages movement, creativity, and social interaction. The curriculum balances structure with flexibility, allowing children to make choices, engage in pretend play, and develop problem-solving skills. Through guided activities and exploration, twos build foundational skills in communication, self-regulation, and collaboration, preparing them for the next stages of learning.
preschool.keyFocus: Encouraging early literacy, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
